title: How to Draw Sandy Cheeks from SpongeBob SquarePants

steps.title: Draw a circle with a rectangle beneath it.
steps.content: Draw a circle with a rectangle beneath it. This should look almost like a snowglobe, or a golf ball on a very large tee.

steps.title: Draw the arms and legs.
steps.content: Draw the arms and legs. Use two short squares for the legs and two tubular shapes on either side of Sandy for her arms.

steps.title: Draw Sandy's hands.
steps.content: Draw Sandy's hands. Make them look like mittens, with all the fingers bunched up in one section and a separate part for the thumb.

steps.title: Draw two squares for the ankles.
steps.content: Draw two squares for the ankles. Add two rectangles at the end of her boots and connect them with diagonal lines.

steps.title: Sketch the head.
steps.content: Sketch the head. Draw a circle with small ovals above ir for the ears. Then add a long oval below the circle and a square for the neck below that.

steps.title: Add Sandy's face.
steps.content: Add Sandy's face. Draw two circles with small circles inside them for the eyes, then add lines above these for the lashes. Draw a triangle for the nose, and for the mouth draw a long curved line Add squares beneath for her teeth.

steps.title: Add details, such as her five-petaled flower and the lines on her suit.
steps.content: Add details, such as her five-petaled flower and the lines on her suit. Remember, the flower goes OUTSIDE of the helmet, not on Sandy's actual head!

steps.title: Ink the drawing.
steps.content: Ink the drawing. Try to make a modular line, which passes from a thin to a thick line and vice versa. Erase any remaining sketch lines.

steps.title: Color the drawing and you're done!
steps.content: Color the drawing and you're done! Sandy's scuba suit is white with accents of red and blue, and her boots are grey.
